definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: The last 4 times decimation was achieved by two half-band filters and a droop FIR.
sentences.chinese: 剩馀4倍抽取采用两级半带滤波器和升幅FIR实现。

sentences.english: In states where unemployment didn't climb as much, claims dropped.
sentences.chinese: 在失业率升幅较小的州，男性的投诉率反而下降。

sentences.english: Average Grade A office rentals are predicted to rise 19% over the next 12 months.
sentences.chinese: 预未十二个月甲级办公平均租升幅约19%。

sentences.english: It's concerning that fruit and vegetable prices have gone up the most.
sentences.chinese: 关于蔬菜和水果类的价格上升幅度最大的问题。

sentences.english: By contrast, the other ASEAN economies saw relatively moderate increases.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，其他东盟地区有相对温和的升幅。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
